gov.fnal.ppd.chat

Class MessagingServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.fnal.ppd.chat.MessagingServer

  • public class MessagingServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The server that can be run both as a console application or a GUI Taken from http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/259777-a-simple-chat-program-with-clientserver-gui-optional/ on 5/12/2014

      One instance of this thread will run for each client

        public void start()
        Start the messaging server

      • stop

        protected void stop()

      • display

        protected void display(java.lang.String msg)
        Display an event (not a message) to the console or the GUI

      • broadcast

        protected void broadcast(java.lang.String message)
        to broadcast a message to all Clients Overrideable if the base class wants to know about the messages. Be sure to call super.broadcast(message) to actually get the message broadcast, though!
        Parameters:
        message - -- The message to broadcast

      • remove

        void remove(int id)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        To run as a console application just open a console window and: > java Server > java Server portNumber If the port number is not specified 1500 is used
        Parameters:
        args - -- The command line arguments. [0] is the port number, otherwise 1500 is assumed
